comments.text:
When using the beta HTML5 video option for you tube video do not play. they page loads and the video window loads but clicking the play button does nothing.
Slider can be grabbed and moved (time shows moving) but does not actually move. 
The slider is 50% off the screen which also seems odd. 
If the HTML5 trial is turned of the video works normally.
This worked in previous versions

Expected results:
HTML5 videos should play just as normal flash ones do.
comments.raw_text:
When using the beta HTML5 video option for you tube video do not play. they page loads and the video window loads but clicking the play button does nothing.
Slider can be grabbed and moved (time shows moving) but does not actually move. 
The slider is 50% off the screen which also seems odd. 
If the HTML5 trial is turned of the video works normally.
This worked in previous versions

Expected results:
HTML5 videos should play just as normal flash ones do.

comments.raw_text: The link I just added to the URL field seems to play fine for me on a 32-bit windows trunk nightly build. Is this definitely limited to Mac?

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Mardeg from comment #1)
> The link I just added to the URL field seems to play fine for me on a 32-bit
> windows trunk nightly build. Is this definitely limited to Mac?

No, this happens on other platforms as well (try http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IGgBWghFgZQ for instance). It doesn't happen on every youtube vid though.

comments.raw_text: Weird bug. The video playback on this link - http://youtu.be/IGgBWghFgZQ - is broken for me on every Nightly and Aurora build (I've checked a few different versions and even 5.0 Nightlies are broken). But it seems to work in any Beta or Release build (again I checked some versions from 5 to 8). IIRC this behavior started merely a week or two ago, so I think it's a Youtube's bug. User agent change doesn't help though.
comments.text: Weird bug. comments.text:
I don't know if this is related, but for me the HTML5 video functionality commonly screws up my Firefox.
I can watch one or two videos (up until the end) but after that there's somehow some junk left behind which stops all videos after that from playing. It just stops at the loading phase, and then it never starts. This happens until I restart Firefox. BUT(!) if I shut down Firefox, it doesn't shut down properly but leaves the process running and I have to kill it using TaskManager. I have to do this to get video working again.

This is happening on Windows 7 (64 bit) with Firefox v.8 to v.10 (still happens).

Should I write a new bug for this? It's very easily reproducible, it happen after a couple of youtube videos in HTML5-mode.
comments.raw_text:
I don't know if this is related, but for me the HTML5 video functionality commonly screws up my Firefox.
I can watch one or two videos (up until the end) but after that there's somehow some junk left behind which stops all videos after that from playing. It just stops at the loading phase, and then it never starts. This happens until I restart Firefox. BUT(!) if I shut down Firefox, it doesn't shut down properly but leaves the process running and I have to kill it using TaskManager. I have to do this to get video working again.

This is happening on Windows 7 (64 bit) with Firefox v.8 to v.10 (still happens).

Should I write a new bug for this? It's very easily reproducible, it happen after a couple of youtube videos in HTML5-mode.
